page.title: 20Changing Times
page.content: Interesting people have been interviewed about the area and how it has changed over the years. There used to be two schools, now there is only one. The main means of transport used to be pony and trap but most people used bicycles. Farming was the main industry and remains so today but it is no longer a big employer of local labour. Quarrying of limestone and copper has long ceased. Hope House used to be the Miners Arms pub and served the miners and quarrymen in its day. Most local people kept a pig and in 1913 there was a cobbler, shopkeeper, joiner, grocer,tea dealer, dressmaker, market gardener and blacksmith in the village. Many changes have taken place and no doubt these changes will continue into the future.
